summary.span: 为键/值对的强类型集合提供 基类。

span.span: Provides the base class for a strongly typed collection of key/value pairs.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 不建议使用 `DictionaryBase` 类进行新的开发。We don't recommend that you use the `DictionaryBase` class for new development. 相反，我们建议使用泛型 或 类。Instead, we recommend that you use the generic or class . 有关详细信息，请参阅 GitHub 上 [不应使用非泛型集合](https://github.com/dotnet/platform-compat/blob/master/docs/DE0006.md) 。For more information, see [Non-generic collections shouldn't be used](https://github.com/dotnet/platform-compat/blob/master/docs/DE0006.md) on GitHub. C # [foreach](/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/foreach-in) 语句和 [每个](/dotnet/visual-basic/language-reference/statements/for-each-next-statement) 语句的 Visual Basic 返回集合中元素的类型的对象。The C# [foreach](/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/foreach-in) statement and the Visual Basic [For Each](/dotnet/visual-basic/language-reference/statements/for-each-next-statement) statement return an object of the type of the elements in the collection. 由于的每个元素 都是键/值对，因此元素类型不是键的类型或值的类型。Since each element of the is a key/value pair, the element type is not the type of the key or the type of the value. 相反，元素类型为 。Instead, the element type is . `foreach`语句是枚举器周围的包装器，它仅允许从集合读取，而不是写入到集合中。The `foreach` statement is a wrapper around the enumerator, which only allows reading from, not writing to, the collection. > [!NOTE] > 因为键可以被继承并且其行为发生了更改，所以使用方法进行的比较无法保证其绝对唯一性 。Because keys can be inherited and their behavior changed, their absolute uniqueness cannot be guaranteed by comparisons using the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现 类，并使用该实现创建 具有 5 个或更少字符的键和值的字典。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

threadsafe.span: 此类型) 成员 Visual Basic 的公共静态 (是线程安全的。

span.span: Public static ( in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 但不保证所有实例成员都是线程安全的。

span.span: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 此实现不提供 (的线程安全) 包装程序的同步 ，但派生类可以使用属性创建其自己的同步版本 。

span.span: This implementation does not provide a synchronized (thread-safe) wrapper for a , but derived classes can create their own synchronized versions of the using the property.

threadsafe.span: 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。

span.span: Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

para.span: 提供此基类是为了使实现者更容易创建强类型的自定义集合。

span.span: This base class is provided to make it easier for implementers to create a strongly typed custom collection.

para.span: 鼓励实现者扩展此基类，而不是自行创建。

span.span: Implementers are encouraged to extend this base class instead of creating their own.

para.span: 此基类的成员是受保护的，仅供通过派生类使用。

span.span: Members of this base class are protected and are intended to be used through a derived class only.

related.span: 执行不区分区域性的字符串操作

span.span: Performing Culture-Insensitive String Operations

summary.span: 返回循环访问 实例的 。

span.span: Returns an that iterates through the instance.
An for the instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位在集合中最后一个元素之后，并 返回 `false` 。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对的后续调用 也将返回 `false` 。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用 返回 `false` ， 则未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 此方法是一种 `O(1)` 操作。This method is an `O(1)` operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现 类，并使用该实现创建 具有 5 个或更少字符的键和值的字典。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

summary.span: 在清除 实例的内容之前执行其他自定义进程。

span.span: Performs additional custom processes before clearing the contents of the instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的默认实现旨在由派生类重写，以在清除集合之前执行某些操作。The default implementation of this method is intended to be overridden by a derived class to perform some action before the collection is cleared. On \* 方法仅在由属性返回的实例上调用 ，而不是在由属性返回的实例上调用 。The On\* methods are invoked only on the instance returned by the property, but not on the instance returned by the property. 此方法的默认实现是一种 `O(1)` 操作。The default implementation of this method is an `O(1)` operation.

para.span: 此方法允许实现程序定义在从基础中删除所有元素之前必须执行的进程 。

span.span: This method allows implementers to define processes that must be performed before deleting all the elements from the underlying .

para.span: 通过定义此方法，实施者可以向继承的方法添加功能，而无需重写所有其他方法。

span.span: By defining this method, implementers can add functionality to inherited methods without having to override all other methods.

para.span: 在标准清除行为之前调用，而 是在标准清楚行为之后调用。

span.span: is invoked before the standard Clear behavior, whereas is invoked after the standard Clear behavior.

para.span: 例如，实施者可以通过全局明文免除某些元素删除。

span.span: For example, implementers can exempt certain elements from deletion by a global Clear.

MemberSignature.Value: bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
.property instance bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized
ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean Implements ICollection.IsSynchronized
property bool System::Collections::ICollection::IsSynchronized { bool get(); };
member this.System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized : bool

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示对 对象的访问是否同步（线程安全）。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether access to a object is synchronized (thread safe).

value.span: 如果对 对象的访问是同步的（线程安全），则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if access to the object is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象不同步。A object is not synchronized. 派生类可以使用属性提供类的同步版本 。Derived classes can provide a synchronized version of the class using the property. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 属性在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the property during the entire enumeration. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/source2.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/source2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/source2.vb#3)] 检索此属性的值是一个 `O(1)` 运算。Retrieving the value of this property is an `O(1)` operation.

summary.span: 获取一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 对象的访问。

span.span: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to a object.

value.span: 一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 对象的访问。

span.span: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生类可以使用属性提供自己的类同步版本 。Derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the class using the property. 同步代码必须对对象的属性执行操作 ，而不是直接对对象执行操作 。The synchronizing code must perform operations on the property of the object, not directly on the object. 这样可确保对从其他对象派生的集合正确地执行操作。This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. 具体而言，它与可能同时修改对象的其他线程保持正确的同步 。Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the object. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 属性在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the property during the entire enumeration. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/source2.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/source2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/source2.vb#3)] 检索此属性的值是一个 `O(1)` 运算。Retrieving the value of this property is an `O(1)` operation.

span.span: Adds an element with the specified key and value into the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常不应将其状态与其哈希代码值之间的关联的对象用作键。An object that has no correlation between its state and its hash code value should typically not be used as the key. 例如， 对象比用作 键的对象更好。For example, objects are better than objects for use as keys. 你还可以使用 属性来添加新元素，方法是设置中不存在的键的值 ; 例如 `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue` 。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the ; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果指定的键已存在于中 ，则设置 属性会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反， 方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 此方法是一种 `O(1)` 操作。This method is an `O(1)` operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现 类，并使用该实现创建 具有 5 个或更少字符的键和值的字典。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是一种 `O(1)` 操作。This method is an `O(1)` operation. 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，此方法使用集合的对象的 和 方法 `key` 来确定是否 `item` 存在。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, this method uses the collection's objects' and methods on `key` to determine whether `item` exists. 在 .NET Framework 的早期版本中，此决定是通过对 `key` 集合中的对象使用参数的和方法进行的。In the earlier versions of the .NET Framework, this determination was made by using the and methods of the `key` parameter on the objects in the collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现 类，并使用该实现创建 具有 5 个或更少字符的键和值的字典。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsFixedSize { get; }
.property instance bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsFixedSize
ReadOnly Property IsFixedSize As Boolean Implements IDictionary.IsFixedSize
property bool System::Collections::IDictionary::IsFixedSize { bool get(); };
member this.System.Collections.IDictionary.IsFixedSize : bool

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示 对象是否具有固定大小。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether a object has a fixed size.

value.span: 如果 对象具有固定大小，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the object has a fixed size; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合不允许在创建集合后添加或删除元素，但允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but does allow the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合就是一个集合，其中包含阻止添加和移除元素的包装;因此，如果对基础集合进行了更改，包括添加或删除元素，则固定大小的集合将反映这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值是一个 `O(1)` 运算。Retrieving the value of this property is an `O(1)` operation.

MemberSignature.Value: bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsReadOnly { get; }
.property instance bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsReadOnly
ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean Implements IDictionary.IsReadOnly
property bool System::Collections::IDictionary::IsReadOnly { bool get(); };
member this.System.Collections.IDictionary.IsReadOnly : bool

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示 对象是否为只读。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether a object is read-only.

value.span: 如果 对象为只读，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the object is read-only; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 只读集合就是一个集合，其中包含阻止修改集合的包装器;因此，如果对基础集合进行了更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值是一个 `O(1)` 运算。Retrieving the value of this property is an `O(1)` operation.

span.span: The value associated with the specified key.

value.span: 如果未找到指定的键，尝试获取它将返回 ，尝试设置它将使用指定的键创建新元素。

span.span: If the specified key is not found, attempting to get it returns , and attempting to set it creates a new element using the specified key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过此属性，可以使用以下语法来访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[key]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[key]`. 你还可以使用 属性来添加新元素，方法是设置中不存在的键的值 ; 例如 `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue` 。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the ; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果指定的键已存在于中 ，则设置 属性会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反， 方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 检索此属性的值是一个 `O(1)` 操作; 设置属性也是一个 `O(1)` 操作。Retrieving the value of this property is an `O(1)` operation; setting the property is also an `O(1)` operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现 类，并使用该实现创建 具有 5 个或更少字符的键和值的字典。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

summary.span: 获取包含 对象中的键的 对象。

value.span: 包含 对象中的键的 对象。

span.span: An object containing the keys in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象中键的顺序未 指定，但与属性返回的对象中的关联值顺序相同 。The order of the keys in the object is unspecified, but is the same order as the associated values in the object returned by the property. 返回的不 是静态副本; 相反， 引用返回到原始对象中的键 。The returned is not a static copy; instead, the refers back to the keys in the original object. 因此，对的更改将 继续反映在返回的中 。Therefore, changes to the continue to be reflected in the returned . 检索此属性的值是一个 `O(1)` 运算。Retrieving the value of this property is an `O(1)` operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现 类，并使用该实现创建 具有 5 个字符或更少的属性的键和值的字典。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a property of 5 characters or less. summary.span: 返回循环访问 的 。

span.span: Returns an that iterates through the .
An for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置，调用会 引发异常。At this position, calling throws an exception. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位在集合中最后一个元素之后，并 返回 `false` 。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对的后续调用 也将返回 `false` 。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用 返回 `false` ，则调用会 引发异常。If the last call to returned `false`, calling throws an exception. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对或的下一个调用将 引发 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 如果在和之间修改集合 ，则 将返回它设置为的元素，即使枚举器已失效也是如此。If the collection is modified between and , returns the element that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. 此方法是一种 `O(1)` 操作。This method is an `O(1)` operation.
